intro: Amberboa omphalodes, commonly known as the liverleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in rocky or dry soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
